title: Ticket #4302: Paired slots should cross-advertise some of each others attributes
description:
Since one member of a slot pair may be hidden (see #4280), in order to have useful displays from condor_status, the visible member of the pair should show state and activity and other attributes of it's partner.

To simplify configuration, they should each advertise some of each others attributes. The set of attributes likely to be cross-advertised would include 

State, Activity, EnteredCurrentActivity, JobId, GlobalJobId, <?>

The set of cross-advertised attributes should be settable by config knob.

Two possible representations of the cross-advertised attributes are proposed.

  • use a nested classad
  • encode as a string

The implementation of this should be such that switching between these two representations should be easy, possibly just by using a config knob.
remarks:
2014-Apr-09 14:30:34 by johnkn:
Further investigation suggests that STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS may be sufficient for this problem. STARTD_SLOT_ATTRS suffers from problems of 'freshness' of cross-advertised attributes, but if that is not a problem we can avoid creating an entirely new mechanism for the initial implementation of 4291.
